summary: An email from Parvin Moyne of Akin Gump law firm to an unidentified recipient regarding a third-party subpoena from the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office to Deutsche Bank. The subpoena seeks information about Jeffrey Epstein's accounts and any government subpoenas previously received by the bank. The email requests permission to disclose the recipient's subpoena and production to the U.S.V.I. AG.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Author of the email, representing Deutsche Bank in responding to a subpoena from the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office regarding Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His estate, executors, and others are defendants in a civil suit filed by the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office, prompting the subpoena to Deutsche Bank.

connections.description: Moyne, as legal counsel for Deutsche Bank, is handling a subpoena related to Epstein's financial accounts and his estate.

events.title: Email regarding U.S.V.I. subpoena to Deutsche Bank
events.description: Parvin Moyne emails an unidentified recipient to request permission to disclose the recipient's subpoena and production to the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office, which is investigating Epstein's estate.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank received a third-party subpoena from the U.S. Virgin Islands Attorney General's Office related to a civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
The subpoena requests copies of any government subpoenas received by Deutsche Bank regarding Epstein and any productions made in response.
Parvin Moyne of Akin Gump law firm is seeking permission from an unidentified recipient to disclose their subpoena and production to the U.S.V.I. AG.
The email indicates ongoing legal proceedings and investigations into Epstein's financial activities posthumously.
